GET /api.description: Returns a JSON object containing all of the available api endpoints, and their descriptions.

GET /api/topics.description: Returns an array of topic objects.

GET /api/users.description: Returns an array containing all users, each user stored in an object with a key of username, name, and avatar_url.

GET /api/users/:username.description: Returns a single user object, that corresopnds to the inputted username. The object will contain properties of username, name, and avatar_url.

GET /api/articles.description: Returns a paginated array of article objects. Each object includes a comment_count and excludes the body field. Supports sorting, ordering, topic filtering, and pagination via query parameters.

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: Returns a single article object, specified by its corresponding article_id. Response will also include the total number of comments (comment_count).

article.title: Running a Node App
article.author: jessjelly
article.body: This is part two of a series on how to get up and running with Systemd and Node.js. This part dives deeper into how to successfully run your app with systemd long-term, and how to set it up in a production environment.

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Returns a paginated array of comment objects, selected via article_id, and sorted by created_at in descending order. Supports pagination via limit and p query parameters.

POST /api/articles.description: Creates a new article. Accepts an object with 'author', 'title', 'body', 'topic', and optionally 'article_img_url' (default image provided if field left unaddressed). Responds with the full newly created article including a comment_count of 0.

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: Adds a new comment to the specified article, via article_id. Requires a username, and a comment body in order to post a comment. Responds with the newly created comment object.

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: Updates the vote count of the specified article, via article_id, by the amount provided in inc_votes.

PATCH /api/comments/:comment_id.description: Updates the vote count of a specific comment via comment_id. Accepts an object with an inc_votes key representing the amount to increment or decrement the comment's current vote count.

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: Deletes a comment, when given the appropriate comment_id. Responds with 204 and no content (an empty object).
